title: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When performing code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as dirtied even though there are no changes made to the file.
OB: The Java file is marked as 'dirtied' after performing code assist, even if no changes were made to the file.
EB: The Java file should not be marked as 'dirtied' if no changes were made to the file after performing code assist.
SR:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl+Space to trigger code assist.
